instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 65Î© to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>. With plugged-in charger, I get 3.3V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and 20V.

Sometimes the short disappear and as soon I give power and remove it the short is back.

When I inject 1-3V into <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>, I can not see any parts that gets even warm and takes 0.06/0.03A. 

What can probably be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message:
"as soon I give power and remove it the short is back"
Always allow 10-15s after power is removed, before checking diode mode, or ohm scale.
If not, the readings may be affected by remanent voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message:
the short appears also after having the board on for 15s 
DFU restore fails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> shorted.
threads.message: I said after 10-15s in OFF mode (power removed).
